node.title: 'Party of Parents': GOP to Build on Fight Against Critical Race Theory for Midterms
node.description: Republicans are planning to strengthen their campaigns against diversity-centered academia in the wake of Tuesday's elections.

node.title: '10 Firemen Later': Video Shows Aftermath of Costco Air Fryer Exploding in Woman's Home
node.description: The TikToker made a simple mistake which caused her air fryer to combust into flames, burning her stove and kitchen floor.

node.title: Internet Backs Deliveryman Allegedly Suspended for Popeyes Rats Video: 'Did Nothing Wrong'
node.description: Popeyes told to Newsweek it has "terminated the franchise agreement" with the location in the video and says the employee "is currently receiving his full pay."

node.title: 11 states sue to block Biden vaccine rule for businesses
node.description: New OSHA regulations are "unconstitutional, unlawful and unwise," argues one state attorney general joining the suit.

node.title: The N.Y.C. Marathon by the Numbers
node.description: Here's a look at some numbers behind the 50th running of the New York City Marathon.

node.title: The Fastest Man Ever to Run the New York City Marathon Has Arrived
node.description: In 2019, Kenenisa Bekele came within two seconds of breaking Eliud Kipchoge’s world record. At 39, the Ethiopian champion has come to New York to prove he can still win anywhere.

node.title: Lawyers for the three accused killers are expected to cite a citizen’s arrest law.
node.description: Lawyers are expected to argue that when Ahmaud Arbery was killed, the men accused of murder were trying to make a citizen’s arrest permitted under state law.

node.title: French Village Mayor Appeals for Help as Migrants Flood Shores on Trek to Britain
node.description: The influx of people making the journey has seen several migrants injured and even killed, while increasingly frequent clashes add to the disarray.

node.title: Krimpets added to Tastykake recall over possible metal pieces
node.description: Potentially tainted cupcakes and cake treats were sold by retailers across the nation, including Target and Walmart.

node.title: Tell Us Your Abortion Story
node.description: We want to hear about your experience in your own voice.

node.title: Kamaru Usman Wants U.F.C. Glory but to Still Live Normally
node.description: Content to hang out with his daughter mostly unbothered, Usman, the U.F.C. welterweight champion, does not aspire for the fame of Conor McGregor. But he does have his eye on something big.

node.title: Persistent shortages are stunting German economic growth.
node.description: The order books in Europe’s largest economy are full, but a lack of parts and raw materials means companies are struggling to fill them.

node.title: NBA investigating allegations against Suns owner Robert Sarver
node.description: The NBA has hired a law firm to investigate the conduct of Phoenix Suns owner Robert Sarver after a new report accused him of racism, sexism and fostering a hostile work environment.

node.title: Civil rights group sues Tennessee over transgender sports ban
node.description: The suit calls the law unconstitutional and discriminatory against transgender children.

node.title: The Jobs Numbers Take the ‘Stag’ Out of the Stagflation Scare
node.description: Americans are going back to work at a rapid clip.

node.title: Former U.S.C. Official to Plead Guilty in College Admissions Scandal
node.description: Donna Heinel will admit to being part of a sweeping scheme that helped fake athletic recruits get into top universities, in exchange for bribes.

node.title: Here are the charges that the defendants face.
node.description: Taken together, the charges provide a number of different ways that the defendants, Gregory McMichael, Travis McMichael and William Bryan, could wind up facing life in prison if they are convicted.

node.title: Here’s what to watch for in the House on Friday.
node.description: If House Democrats succeed, they will pass two marquee pieces of legislation by day’s end, sending one bill to the president’s desk and the other to the Senate.

node.title: Influential LGBT Advocacy Group Shuts Down in China Amid Crackdown on Social Activism
node.description: "We are deeply regretful to tell everyone, Queer Advocacy Online will stop all of our work indefinitely," the group said, referring to its social media account.

node.title: Republican Adam Kinzinger Says Lies Are 'Standard' Under Trump, McCarthy Leadership
node.description: The GOP congressman's criticism came after McCarthy claimed he had lobbied to become Air Force secretary in Trump's administration.

node.title: Edward Durr's Twitter, Facebook Pages Not Available After Offensive Posts Resurfaced
node.description: "If I said things in the past that hurt anybody's feelings, I sincerely apologize," Durr said in a statement.

node.title: Internet Drags Woman Who Refused to Acknowledge Friend's Fiancé as Co-Homeowner
node.description: "It's not your place to 'correct' them when they're both happy with the way they've organized things," one commenter wrote
